ygData.subject: Re: Official confirmation from Ester
ygData.msgSnippet: Yep and as much as I hate to say it, I ve given up on my bard.  I m so tired of fighting with Verant over this.  I just tested lullaby yesterday.  36% resist
ygData.messageBody:
Yep and as much as I hate to say it, I've given up on
my bard. I'm so tired of fighting with Verant over
this. I just tested lullaby yesterday. 36% resist
rate on a_snake, 40% resist rate an orc centurion.
I'm 41 level higher and 33 levels higher respectively.
I just can't believe they expect us to accept this.

Like most others, I doubt I will buy anything else
from Verant. Sure I'll give StarWars online a shot
but EQ2, no.

I've started an Enchanter. She's 6th now. I have 4
friends dedicated to powerleveling her. I'm tired of
fighting them so I give up. When AO comes out, I'll
be one less player in EQ. Till then, I guess I'll
follow the vision like a good little customer.

To those of you that stay and fight for changes to the
bardic class, I wish you all the luck in the world.
You will be fighting a company that either doesn't
understand you or is unwilling to make changes for the
better.

Best of luck,

Centiera D'Winter
42nd Retired Half-Elf Bard
Bristlebane

>Too bad it no longer works on mobs below 30 either.
>I'm sure that's now "as intended" as well. What a
>load of BS. This game has become EnchanterQuest,
>since at higher levels that's what you do. Quest
>about looking for an Enchanter so you can fight more
>than two mobs at a time underground.
